intro: Ozoroa insignis var. intermedia, commonly known as the red-veined nettle, is a species of flowering plant in the family Urticaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, including countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its distinctive red veins on the leaves, which give it its common name. It typically grows as an upright shrub with opposite, serrated leaves. The flowers are small and clustered, often green or yellowish, and are borne in dense inflorescences.
